text.value: Below is a passage with some words missing. These words are important when writing essays about the Renaissance, a period described by the historian Emil Male as “antiquity ennobled by the Christian Church”. Select the correct word or phrase into the correct part of the passage.

An essential part of a princely/aristocratic training was a education (the study of classical antiquity through the ‘humanities’: grammar, rhetoric, history, poetry, and moral philosophy). Clever, like all the Tudors, Henry was an excellent . He certainly would have understood, and probably dictated the Latin script on the . Pointedly, the script asks us to compare the two kings, Henry VIII and his father, Henry VII. Henry VII had seized the crown for the Lancastrians at the Battle of Bosworth in 1485, rescuing, so we are told, the English , making Henry senior a ‘great’ king. However, Henry VIII is the ‘greater king’ for rescuing the English , a reference to Henry’s triumph over Roman Catholicism. Other classical elements enforce the image of a fashionable prince – the frieze, the that break up the back wall of the room into equal bays, and the Roman emperor in profile.

reveal.value:
• plinth and pilasters are architectural terms
  • all’antica is an Italian term relating to art meaning “in the manner of the ancients”
  • humanist and classicist relate to educational terms
